messages.messageBody:
Hi mama, also here in NJ. Welcome to the list.

Bonnie


>From: Mamaperk@...
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] New here and still nervous
>Date: Tue, 22 May 2001 12:17:15 -0000
>
>Hello! My name is Sherry and I am an unschooling <ahem> or is it
>homeschooling mother of three in New Jersey. We brought our oldest
>child home to 'school' after he completed second grade in public
>school. That was June 1998 and I still struggle
>with 'UN'schooling... I truly believe, in my heart and soul, that
>children learn best when they are interested and passionate about
>something and yet I occasionally backslide and panic, give him a very
>small and simple handwriting assignment to be sure he is actually
>learning. It's pathetic! LOL! I think I still need to DEschool.
>
>I'm happy to have found this email list and look forward to
>networking with you. : )
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New here and still nervous
messages.msgSnippet: Welcome Sherry!  You sound like me.  I am guilty of the same thing!!  I try not to, but every now and then I just gotta see something on paper. Like you said:
messages.messageBody:
Welcome Sherry! You sound like me. I am guilty
of the same thing!! I try not to, but every now
and then I just gotta see something on paper.
Like you said: I need to be de-schooled too!
Anyway, welcome to the list, look forward to
sharing with you! :-)


=====
Kim - Missouri MOM of Dylan(11) Jacob(10) Noah(21 mos)

messages.subject: New here and still nervous
messages.msgSnippet: Hello!  My name is Sherry and I am an unschooling   or is it homeschooling mother of three in New Jersey.  We brought our oldest child home to school
messages.messageBody:
Hello! My name is Sherry and I am an unschooling <ahem> or is it
homeschooling mother of three in New Jersey. We brought our oldest
child home to 'school' after he completed second grade in public
school. That was June 1998 and I still struggle
with 'UN'schooling... I truly believe, in my heart and soul, that
children learn best when they are interested and passionate about
something and yet I occasionally backslide and panic, give him a very
small and simple handwriting assignment to be sure he is actually
learning. It's pathetic! LOL! I think I still need to DEschool.

I'm happy to have found this email list and look forward to
networking with you. : )
